sentence.Network_en: We only had a fleeting glimpse of the sun all day.

sentence.Network_en: Art is long , and time is fleeting.

sentence.Network_en: The world is like a fleeting show.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English (in the sense 'floating, swimming'): from fleet + -ing

entry.def: Fleeting is used to describe something which lasts only for a very short time.

example.ex: The girls caught only a fleeting glimpse of the driver...
example.tran: 女孩们只匆匆瞥了一眼司机。

example.ex: She wondered for a fleeting moment if he would put his arm around her.
example.tran: 他会不会搂住自己，这个念头在她脑子里一闪而过。

means.word_mean: 1. lasting for a markedly brief time;

sentences.sentence: "rapid momentaneous association of things that meet and pass"

auth_sentence.content: Stability will be more and more fleeting perhaps permanently.
